comment: This class was super interesting and Professor Nadeau offered many ways to learn. She grades really fast and is quick to answer questions. If you do the work, you will do well in the class. The class was well-organized and Professor Nadeau sent loads of reminders for deadlines. Really enjoyed this class! Take her!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: I would literally never take this professor again. she never provided clear material to study for the tests or any kind of study guide for help. The class averaged 50's and below on tests and she still did not care. NEVER. AGAIN.

Research Methods is a tough class, but with Dr. Nadeau, you're in good hands. She is super helpful and never tests you on something not covered in the textbook homework. There are some time-consuming and daunting assignments but they're assigned in an order to help you grow and learn. She's awesome!

I mean this is the easiest and most enjoyable class I've taken. I genuinely loved the discussion and loved the prompts. The assignments on Launchpad take 5 minutes and it's on socratic. A lot of it is self explanatory. The tests are on lockdown, but quizzes aren't.

She was honestly an angel and I loved all of the activities we had to do. There is a lot of group discussion but you have the choice of typing it or making a video, which I thought was much easier. Her instructions are very clear and all of the assignments are VERY easy to complete. If I could rate higher I would because she was great.

Professor Nadeau is overall a great professor. I took her online class and she would let me send her my papers ahead of time to get feedback on. I made a B overall in her class even though I got C's and D's on her tests. Her tests are very difficult and hard to do well on. Everything else is easy and she does offer extra credit.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: Very predictable workload every week. Read the textbook, helps a lot. There is an interactive little lesson but those answers can be found on quizlet and take less than five minutes to do a week. Quizzes weekly, not difficult if you read (can be found on quizlet too). A few discussion posts, nothing ridiculous. If you read the textbook, you're set

She's honestly a really nice professor. She's so accessible with her office hours, gives a lot of feedback, and is super caring. The tests weren't that bad, just make sure to read the textbook heavily. There is a clear rubric, and as long as you follow it and make sure your essays are good, you'll be fine. However, take them seriously! 10/10
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Honestly, one of the best professors I've had this far. The class was alot of work, and the tests were difficult but you could email the professor at any given point for advice and she will be more than helpful. She always responded to my emails fast and was always extremely helpful and made me feel like she actually cared.

The class work was easy but when it came to the test they were extremely hard. They were like 10x harder than the hw assignments so you wont be prepared for the rigor actually on the test. Only down side of the class.

I have just taken her online class ( Fall 2020). I remember that in the first week she mentioned that only because it was a 101 class, that did not mean that it was an easy class. She is super caring, answers the e-mails right away, and your questions. She created extra credit to help out some students. She goes above and beyond. Very easy going!

Even though the class was online due to Covid, Prof. Nadeau was intentional in connecting with the students and making sure we had the tools to succeed. She responds to emails and enters grades VERY quickly. She's caring and will work with you if you put in the time.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Professor Nadeau was a great professor. If you need additional assistance she is always there to help. Test are extremely hard so I suggest studying way in advance but overall the class was great. I would definitely take her class again

She is a great professor and will work with you if you ask. I would have her look over my projects & papers to get feedback before I turn it in and shes always happy to do it. However, the tests didnt seem to always reflect what the study guides consisted of, but she adds a curve. There were 3 tests, weekly textbook assignments, projects & papers
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: She was professional and fair. She also provided resources to help guide your reading, like chapter outlines to guide your reading notes. Always available to chat and truly cares about the students. I really loved her! If I have the option to retake her, I will!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I took Prof. Angela, Fall semester 2020 and it was online. Prof. Angela is easily accessible through email and the more you reach out to her the more she will work with you. The class had 4 exams, the final replaces the lowest test score. There were a lot of discussions (voice threads) so be ready to participate. An easy A if you work for it.

I took this class completely asynchronous online and it was easy and enjoyable! There are many discussion posts so be prepared for those but as long as you read the rubric they are easy As. Each week is a module with about 1-2 chapters in the book and a few easy assignments to go with it. Tests were easy just reread textbook chapters to study.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria
